section_id: ## 12.3. The Complete Lyapunov Drift Under Cloning

hints.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
hints.content:
8086: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8087: 
8088: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8089: 
8090: $$
8091: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8092: $$
8093: 
8094: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8095: 
8096: $$
8097: \begin{aligned}
8098: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8099: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8100: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8101: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8102: \end{aligned}
8103: $$
8104: 
8105: **Combined Drift:**
8106: 
8107: $$
8108: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8109: $$
8110: 
8111: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8112: 
8113: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8114: 
8115: $$
8116: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}

hints.raw_directive:
8083: ### 12.3.1. Main Result
8084: 
8085: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
8086: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8087: 
8088: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8089: 
8090: $$
8091: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8092: $$
8093: 
8094: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8095: 
8096: $$
8097: \begin{aligned}
8098: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8099: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8100: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8101: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8102: \end{aligned}
8103: $$
8104: 
8105: **Combined Drift:**
8106: 
8107: $$
8108: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8109: $$
8110: 
8111: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8112: 
8113: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8114: 
8115: $$
8116: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}
8117: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.content:
8121: :::{prf:proof}
8122: :label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
8123: **Proof.**
8124: 
8125: The total drift is obtained by summing the component drifts with their respective weights:
8126: 
8127: $$
8128: \begin{aligned}
8129: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \\
8130: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V (\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}]) + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b]
8131: \end{aligned}
8132: $$
8133: 
8134: Substituting the individual bounds from Theorems 10.3.1, 10.4.1, 11.3.1, and 12.2.1:
8135: 
8136: $$
8137: \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x + C_v) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8138: $$
8139: 
8140: Rearranging:
8141: 
8142: $$
8143: = -c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} - c_B \kappa_b W_b + (C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b)
8144: $$
8145: 
8146: For the drift to be negative, we need the contraction terms to dominate:
8147: 
8148: $$
8149: c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B \kappa_b W_b > C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b
8150: $$
8151: 
8152: This holds when the weighted variance and boundary potential are sufficiently large.

hints.label: prop-kinetic-necessity
hints.title: Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
hints.content:
8190: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8191: 
8192: The cloning operator alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution. Specifically:
8193: 
8194: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8195: 
8196: 2. **Inter-swarm divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8197: 
8198: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8199: 
8200: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8201: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)

8187: ### 12.3.3. Why Cloning Alone Cannot Achieve Convergence
8188: 
8189: :::{prf:proposition} Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
8190: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8191: 
8192: The cloning operator alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution. Specifically:
8193: 
8194: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8195: 
8196: 2. **Inter-swarm divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8197: 
8198: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8199: 
8200: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8201: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)
8202: - Contract $V_W$ via hypocoercive drift and confining potential (overcoming $C_W$)
